intro: Enterosora devoluta, commonly known as the hairy bladderworts, is a genus of aquatic and semi-aquatic plants belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, bladder-like structures used for capturing small aquatic organisms. They typically grow in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. Enterosora devoluta has slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are usually small and inconspicuous, with distinctive spurred petals.
